I'm able to reproduce the issue on other Linux machine. I tried SUSE9:
$uname -a
Linux lab1 2.6.5-7.97-bigsmp #1 SMP Fri Jul 2 14:21:59 UTC 2004 i686 i686 i386 GNU/Linux

I reproduced the described crash and exception. Also I was able to start profiling several times. Usually I was getting org.eclipse.core.runtime.CoreException.

I tried this this morning with Linux SuSE SLES 9. At first the remote JVMTI profiles were just slow (and sometimes interrupted in the middle such as for StartStop)...but after three profiles I got the same runtime.CoreException as seen above. Sometimes I also don't get any data (all profiling types, including probekit).
I have been running into this on EM64T as well but only when I use a SUN JRE. The IBM JRE allows a remote profile.

I've investigated the issue one more time with assistance from Igor.
Here is my conclusion.
While I was trying to profile remotly at first all AC and JRE binaries were located remotely on file server. I copied these binaries to Linux machine local disk and profiling launcher became faster and connection with AC became more stable. As a result I was able to profiler though some AC failures occurred. In case of localhost profiling if all AC and JRE binaries are local profiler launching works as expected.
So it looks like the reason of described failures is inconsistence between AC and the Client internal timeouts and various network delays.

Lowering severity and retargeting to future because:
When all binaries (Eclipse, java, AC) are installed on a local Linux disk, profiling works fine. Problem is encountered with binaries installed on network disk.

Since local installation allows normal functioning of profiler, my understanding is that Viacheslav agrees to the lowering of the severity and to the retarget of this bug to the next release.
It is not reproduced with current build (4.4.1-200709060100).
